greeting: Greetings from The On-Line Encyclopedia of Integer Sequences! http://oeis.org/

results.name: a(n) is the product of primes (with multiplicity) of form 4*k+1 that divide n.
comment: Completely multiplicative with a(p) = p if p = 4k+1 and a(p) = 1 otherwise. - _Tom Edgar_, Mar 05 2015
link: Alois P. Heinz, Table of n, a(n) for n = 1..10000
A. Tripathi, On Pythagorean triples containing a fixed integer, Fib. Q., 46/47 (2008/2009), 331-340.
mathematica: a[n_] := Product[{p, e} = pe; If[Mod[p, 4] == 1, p^e, 1], {pe, FactorInteger[n]}];
program: return 1 if n == 1 else prod(i**f[i] for i in f if i % 4 != 1)
def a(n): return n//a072438(n) # _Indranil Ghosh_, May 08 2017
results.author: _N. J. A. Sloane_, Dec 22 2009
